intro: Trymalium floribundum subsp. trifidum, commonly known as the three-lobed lomatia, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its distinctive trifid (three-lobed) leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in shrublands and open woodlands. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
